name: Chateau de Roussan

reviews.text: We were all impressed as we drove up the tree lined driveway to this Grand Chateau. While updated inside, the period nature has been preserved. The suites are large and have views of the gardens. As other reviews have noted, this is not a chain hotel - these rooms have a more personal feel, period style fireplaces, furniture and architecture. The gardens are extensive and a quiet evening glass of bubbles at the outside table is a real joy. The staff were excellent , and nothing was too much trouble. The Chateau is only a few minutes drive outside St Remy (I wouldn't suggest walking). The restaurant in the Chateau is classy and upmarket and we ate dinner there once. The food was superb with an excellent choice of wine. However, my taste leans to some of the restaurants in St Remy town which offered a more relaxed environment but with still very good food and wine. We didn't eat breakfast at the Chateau, preferring instead to stop in the town for a coffee/tea and some local pastries etc as we headed out for the day. Our stay at the Chateau was delightful, but if you are travelling in peak time the town would be very busy and parking more challenging, so it might be easier to stay at a hotel in town - particularly if you enjoy a glass of wine with your meal.
reviews.title: Grand Chateau with Picturesque Gardens

reviews.text: We stayed at the Chateau de Roussan for just over a week, as a family with two young children (6yrs and less than 2 yrs). Over that time the Chateau and its staff charmed us completely. Chateau de Roussan will be the upcoming place to stay in and around St Remy but it currently has one significant drawback (see below).
reviews.title: Wonderful place, incredible service - almost the complete package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chateau de Roussan has an idyllic country setting about 5 mins by car; 20 mins good walk from the centre of St Remy (that's the same as Chateau des Alpilles which it neighbours).
reviews.title: It's a place you'll never forget: charming, shabby chic, on the strange side for the adventurous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked our stay here months ago and couldn't wait to get here. We were not disappointed. The chateau takes you back in time. We were warmly greeted by the staff at reception and personally shown to our room, named Maguelone. The room itself was quite large, very clean and nicely appointed. We had both a bathtub and a walk in shower, and dressing area. The view was fantastic, looking out the front of the chateau, back down the tree lined lane which leads you in. Free wifi is available in your room. The grounds are lovely, a park like setting with many trees and a small stream. Be sure to stroll around and enjoy the peace and quiet.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in St. Remy

reviews.text: Our bed was very comfortable, giving us a quiet, great night's sleep. The breakfast was not cheap, but excellent quality. Juices, fruit, breads, meat, cheese, eggs, yougurt are all available. The food is fresh and very tasty.
reviews.title: I want to go back...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, we can't say enough about the staff. Everyone at reception speaks English and couldn't be more friendly and helpful. They are ready with suggestions for side trips, places to eat or just to talk about your day. We would love to go back to St. Remy and if we do we will definitely stay again at Chateau de Roussan.
reviews.title: Charming and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the neatest experience we had in france. We stumbled upon this treasure out of sheer luck. The accomodations were lovely, service top notch and the grounds immaculate. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: such a beautiful place!

reviews.text: The drive down the tree lined street to the chateau was a great way to begin our visit. The buildings and grounds are beautiful and the staff welcomed us warmly. We stayed in a nice room upstairs just past the charming library. The bed and bathroom were very nice except that the sheets were somewhat stiff. Felt like they were brand new and had never been washed. Other than that, I highly recommend the chateau. The staff was excellent and very willing to provide whatever recommendations they could. Had a wonderful dinner outside on the front patio and a great conversation about wine with our waiter who is from Burgundy. It's a short drive from St Remy and one can easily drive the other direction on D99 towards Arles and the Pont du Gard.
reviews.title: Loads of character and fabulous food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and me were ther for six nights, we were in the suite Clairette, everything was great, very good hotel, parking, gardens, people, clean, Restaurant was very very good, excellent diners and wines.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst was the breakfast, 20€ for a buffet is not good.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: The most pleaseant in Provence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chateau Roussan for 4 nights and absolutely loved it. The rooms are updated but still maintain their historic charm. Our room was huge and very comfortable. The grounds were beautiful, the pictures on the website hardly do it justice! The staff was extremely helpful and gave us great suggestions for local sightseeing and driving directions. The restaurant had some inventive meals, but we preferred to dine in the city, as it was cheaper and a bit more tasty. Highly recommend staying here!!
reviews.title: Perfection Plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so charmed by the setting, and the attention & care shown by the staff was the icing on the cake! Intelligent responses to queries on local attractions, thoughtful suggestions (i.e. tea in a particular spot on the rounds) & overall graciousness by everyone. Can't wait to return in the fall!
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect.

description: Only the XIIIth century could offer such a charming mansion, only 2km away from Saint‐Rémy de Provence. As you’ll slowly walk down the elegant alley of centennial plane trees, you’ll discover the “Château de Roussan”, designed by a brilliant French architect. Enchanted by his creation, he offered it a façade decorated with an elegant balcony overlooked by a majestic front wall; in the manner of a theatre stage set.
